results.title: Reefer madness
results.creator_credit: Louis Gasnier, George A. Hirliman, G and H Production and Motion Picture Ventures, Inc
results.brief_description: During the 1930’s, one of the favourite subjects of ‘poverty row’ exploitation low budget “Warning!” films was the evils of “the devil’s weed” - marijuana. Pure campy melodrama and completely hilarious by current standards, these films were considered tight drama under the guise of warning the audience of how one puff of pot can destroy young lives and lead clean-cut teenagers down the road of insanity and death. The plot of “Reefer Madness” is no different, with a young man’s life becoming a nightmare with Miles’ frenzied piano solo a highlight of the film. Originally titled “The Burning Question” and then “Tell Your Children.” Starring Dorothy Short, Kenneth Craig, Lillian Miles, Dave O’Brien, Thelma White and Carleton Young.

results.title: Reedy river
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Keith Gow, Peter Hamilton and Peter Hamilton Productions
results.brief_description: Lawson’s poem is dramatised and set to music in a pastoral setting. Describes the hardships and joys of settling in virgin country, and for the settler, the greatest hardship of all, the loss of his beautiful wife. Uses flashback technique. Enacted by Jock Levy and Sylvia Salisbury while the words are sung by Alex Hood, Barbara Lysiak and the Ramblers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Keith Gow, Peter Hamilton and Peter Hamilton Productions

results.title: Reds
results.brief_description: The story of the love affair of John Reed and Louise Bryant in a war-torn world and how the Russian Revolution shook their lives. Warren Beatty is John Reed, American Communist, journalist and activist who was buried in the Kremlin Wall. Diane Keaton is Louise Bryant, writer and feminist, whose love for Reed carries her across continents. Jack Nicholson is Eugene O’Neill, America’s greatest playwright, whose life intertwines romantically with Bryant’s. Maureen Stapleton portrays anarchist and feminist Emma Goldman, and Jerzy Kosinski plays Bolshevik leader Gregory Zinoviev.

results.title: Redreaming the dark
results.creator_credit: Romaine Moreton, Charlotte Seymour, Erica Glynn and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
During an electricity blackout in the family apartment, a young intellectually challenged Black woman has her life suddenly thrown into turmoil. Her grandmother soothes the young girl, teaching her not only to embrace the dark but also to love her dark self. Together the three women “redream” the dark.
Cast: Emily Walker, Leah Purcell, Irma Woods

results.title: Rediscovery: art media - paper mache
results.brief_description: Presents the basic process involved in sculpting and creating 3-D forms using paper mache - one of the cheapest and easiest ways of creating objects. Jewelry, toy houses, elephants, birds etc - from paper strips to paper mulch students develop their own creative ideas. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Rediscovered harmonies
results.creator_credit: Lucien Peroisy and Sofidoc S A
results.brief_description: The origin of different musical instruments. The Music Instrumental du Conservatoire de Brussels has a large collection of instruments some dating from prehistoric times. The film uses this collection to present an insight into the origin of musical instruments and describes the development from the Middle Ages to the present.

results.title: Redfern Now
results.brief_description: Redfern Now is a kaleidoscopic drama that explores this inner-city suburb and the people who inhabit it. The highly celebrated and multi award-winning drama series written, directed and produced by Indigenous creatives.

constellations_other.name: Jedda: Uneven ground, the road to on-screen diversity
constellations_other.description: Jedda was the first fully funded Australian feature to be shot on colour film. It was also the first Australian film with Aboriginal actors in lead roles, however, it reflects a deeply problematic time in Australian history.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

constellations_other.name: Canopy
constellations_other.description: John Harvey is a Torres Strait Islander producer, director and writer in screen and stage whose work Canopy celebrates Indigenous self-representation.

constellations_other.name: Aboriginal History Archive
constellations_other.description: The Aboriginal History Archive at Victoria University, led by Gary Foley, is dedicated to the collection and preservation of First Peoples' stories and cultural material. The political activism of the Black Power movement in the 1970s is intersected with representation of Aboriginal actors on screen.

results.description: Redfern Now is a kaleidoscopic drama that explores this inner-city suburb and the people who inhabit it. The highly celebrated and multi award-winning drama series written, directed and produced by Indigenous Australians
description_for_label: Redfern Now is a kaleidoscopic drama that explores this inner-city suburb and the people who inhabit it. The highly celebrated and multi award-winning drama series written, directed and produced by Indigenous Australians

results.title: Redfern Beach (D)
results.creator_credit: Catriona McKenzie, Yvonne Maden, Rachel Roberts and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An islander Max (Michael Huahihe) finds himself working at a fish processing plant and struggles to be accepted. Unsure of the violent lifestyle, he attempts to move on once given perspective when befriended by Harry (Tony Barry), a local fisherman and his new lover, Phaedra.

results.title: Redfern Beach
results.creator_credit: Rachel Roberts, Catriona McKenzie and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Max needs to choose between money and love. An old bagman gives Max a magic fishing lure. As colour begins to seep into his life, the choice becomes clear.
Cast features Michael Tuahine, Phaedra Nicolaidis, Nicholas Papademetriou and Tony Barry.

results.title: Redex round Australia car trials: 1953, 1954, 1955
results.creator_credit: Sally Jackson and Screen Sound Australia
results.brief_description: Screen Sound Australia uses newsreels and home movie footage, photographs, newspapers and interviews to present a detailed account of the world famous Redex trials held in Australia between 1953 and 1955. Over a distance of 6,500 miles, competitors drove standard passenger vehicles on a designated route around the eastern half of Australia. Rather than being a race, competitors were required to complete every segment in a fixed time, losing points if they arrived at any destination a minute early or late. We see the thrills and spills of the races as well as the cunning and ingenuity of the drivers who maneuvered their cars along dusty and hazardous outback routes where there was no access to motels, petrol stations, or even roads.
